reviews.subject: English Literature
reviews.review: Dr. Hawthorne's passion for literature is contagious. Her lectures are engaging and thought-provoking. However, the workload can be heavy at times.

reviews.subject: Computer Science
reviews.review: Brilliant instructor! Prof. Chen explains complex concepts clearly and is always willing to help during office hours. His projects are challenging but rewarding.

reviews.subject: Biology
reviews.review: Dr. Johnson knows her subject well, but her lectures can be dry. The lab sessions are informative, though sometimes disorganized.

reviews.subject: History
reviews.review: Prof. Garcia brings history to life! His storytelling approach makes even the most obscure historical events fascinating. Assignments are fair and well-designed.

reviews.subject: Physics
reviews.review: Dr. Patel seems knowledgeable, but struggles to explain concepts at an undergraduate level. Exams are much harder than the material covered in class.

reviews.subject: Psychology
reviews.review: Prof. Kim's classes are always interesting. He incorporates real-world examples and encourages class discussions. Sometimes goes off-topic, but overall a great teacher.

reviews.subject: Chemistry
reviews.review: Dr. Thompson is an exceptional educator. Her explanations are clear, and she makes complex chemical concepts accessible. Always available for extra help.

reviews.subject: Economics
reviews.review: Prof. Wilson is knowledgeable but can be intimidating. His classes are challenging and the curve is harsh. However, you'll learn a lot if you can keep up.

reviews.subject: Sociology
reviews.review: Dr. Rodriguez brings fresh perspectives to sociological theories. Her assignments encourage critical thinking. Sometimes lectures run over time.

reviews.subject: Mathematics
reviews.review: Prof. Lee is clearly brilliant, but has difficulty explaining concepts to students who aren't math prodigies. Office hours are not very helpful.

reviews.subject: Art History
reviews.review: Dr. Brown's lectures are like guided tours through art museums. Her enthusiasm is infectious, and she makes even the most obscure artworks interesting.

reviews.subject: Political Science
reviews.review: Prof. Ivanov presents balanced views on complex political issues. Assignments can be demanding, but they significantly improve analytical skills.

reviews.subject: Environmental Science
reviews.review: Dr. Murphy is passionate about the subject, but her teaching style can be inconsistent. Field trips are the highlight of the course.

reviews.subject: Engineering
reviews.review: Prof. Ahmed's practical approach to engineering problems is invaluable. He brings industry experience into the classroom and prepares students well for their careers.

reviews.subject: Neuroscience
reviews.review: Dr. Lee's lectures are fascinating and well-structured. The course is challenging but rewarding. More hands-on lab work would be appreciated.

reviews.subject: Philosophy
reviews.review: Prof. Martin encourages deep thinking, but can be vague in his explanations. Grading criteria are sometimes unclear. Interesting class discussions though.

reviews.subject: Linguistics
reviews.review: Dr. Simmons makes linguistics accessible and fun. Her interactive teaching style and real-world examples help concepts stick. Highly recommended!

reviews.subject: Business Administration
reviews.review: Prof. Taylor seems more interested in his research than teaching. Lectures are often cancelled or poorly prepared. The course relies heavily on the textbook.

reviews.subject: Anthropology
reviews.review: Dr. Chang brings anthropology to life with her fieldwork stories. Assignments are creative and thought-provoking. Heavy reading load, but worth it.

reviews.subject: Music Theory
reviews.review: Prof. Nelson is clearly an accomplished musician, but his teaching can be hit or miss. Some concepts are explained well, others are rushed through.
